titleInfo.title: USA v. Goodin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - The Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska is appointed to represent the above named defendant in this matter as to defendant Henry Goodin. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - The Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska is appointed to represent the above named defendant in this matter as to defendant Henry Goodin. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goodin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - A final dispositional hearing will be held before Judge Joseph F. Bataillon in Courtroom No.3, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, on June11, 2009 at 1:30 a.m. regarding the Petition for Offender Under Supervision 3. Defendant must be present in person. The defendant is committed to the custody of the Attorney General, as to defendant Henry Goodin. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - A final dispositional hearing will be held before Judge Joseph F. Bataillon in Courtroom No.3, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, on June11, 2009 at 1:30 a.m. regarding the Petition for Offender Under Supervision 3. Defendant must be present in person. The defendant is committed to the custody of the Attorney General, as to defendant Henry Goodin. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goodin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT IS ORDERED that the Defendant's Conditions of Supervised Release are amended. The United States Marshal is ordered to release the Defendant to the custody of the Federal Public Defender's office on August 5, 2009, to be transported to Williams Prepared Place. He shall continue to reside at such facility and obey all rules of said facility. He shall remain subject to all other conditions of supervised release previously set by the Court, and if he is discharged from the facility for any reason, a warrant for his arrest shall issue and he shall be produced before the Court for a prompt hearing. He shall also, unless otherwise ordered, appear before the Court for the final dispositional hearing previously set by the Court on August 25, 2009, at 8:30 a.m. as to defendant Henry Goodin. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)(TCL)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goodin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding PETITION FOR OFFENDER UNDER SUPERVISION 19 as to defendant Henry Goodin. The defendant should be held to answer for a final dispositional hearing before Chief Judge Bataillon. A final dispositional hearing will be held before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon in Courtroom No.3, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, on November 23, 2009 at 10:30 a.m. Defendant must be present in person.The defendant is released on current conditions of supervision. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER regarding PETITION FOR OFFENDER UNDER SUPERVISION 19 as to defendant Henry Goodin. The defendant should be held to answer for a final dispositional hearing before Chief Judge Bataillon. A final dispositional hearing will be held before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon in Courtroom No.3, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, on November 23, 2009 at 10:30 a.m. Defendant must be present in person.The defendant is released on current conditions of supervision. titleInfo.title: USA v. Goodin
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT(For Revocation of Probation or Supervised Release) as to defendant Henry Goodin. Defendant admitted guilt to violation of special condition 1 and the mandatory condition which states the defendant will not commit another federal, state or local crime during the term of supervision. The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 12 months and 1 day. The defendant shall be given credit for federal time served and may serve this sentence concurrent to any sentence imposed by Washington County, Nebraska; No term of supervised release is imposed; $100 Special Assessment. Allegation 1 and 2 of the Petition are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)(TCL )
